response: I'm not yet sure if he's guilty, but it seems more likely than not that he is. The alibi he provided was that he was at work, yet none of his coworkers would back up his story.
Imagine being in her shoes. First your father dies, then your vulture of a boyfriend points a gun at you.
And if he's not guilty, your killer is still at large, the police not having a single other suspect.
I honestly can't believe this guy. Sure, there was a lot of blood. And sure, he did get socked in the fact real good. But he acted as if he had survived some sort of near-death experience.
It was a punch to the face, dude. Get over it.
I met her during the first round of jury selection. She seemed very hurried to get the whole thing done.

Oh, I've heard of that! It's that thing where jurors can decide to acquit a defendant even they know he's guilty. If the jurors think the defendant had a good reason for what they did, they can vote not guilty in spite of the facts.
I'm surprised the attourney general didn't ask me about that when she interviewed me. Normally they always ask.
Money is the motive to end all motives.
People break into cars to steal the change from the cup holders. It's not a big leap to this, especially when the dollar value is so high.
He named one coworker in particular that he says he talked to that night. But when that coworker took the stand, he testified that he did not remember seeing him at all.
Why would he name a specific person if it was all bullshit?

text: Well that was interesting. Pretty cool that we got a murder trial. Very interesting stuff!
He testified during the case that he had the gun for years.
If you hold something while wearing gloves, would it smudge any existing fingerprints?
Would it be possible to tell whether someone wearing gloves held the gun at some point after the defendant?
You saw the crime scene? That's pretty sweet.
Those photos they showed of the officer's face had a lot of blood in them.
Maybe kicked the officer instead of punshing him?

acquitEntirely: I'm not saying he's definitely innocent, but there just isn't enough evidence to convict.
chargeWithAssault: It doesn't look like he was the killer, but he did assault that poor officer!
guiltyShotgun: All of the evidence puts him on the other end of that shotgun.
guiltyMotivePlusOpportunity: The defendant had both motive and opportunity.
